case.name: Don Patch Arrives
case.description: Instead of exposing himself, Bobobo brings in Don Patch as a shield and one last strip-tribute.

case.name: Double the Undies
case.description: Bobobo reveals he is wearing a second pair of underwear under his initial pair. What hijinks.

case.name: Bobobo Strips Everything
case.description: Bobobo tears off his jacket, pants, shirt, shoes, and socks in one go for his first loss. Standard stuff.

case.name: Your Hair is Calling
case.description: Bobobo hears someone's hair calling out to him. Maybe it's yours! Did you use off-brand shampoo?

case.name: Triple the Undies
case.description: Turns out Bobobo is wearing yet another pair of underwear, making 3 in total. Truly visionary.

markers.marker: Amy, like Beauty, has pink hair. Bobobo makes this connection (genius).
Bobobo probes deeper for a possible Amy/Beauty connection.
Bobobo wants to steal the Master Emerald. No real reason why, just a way to kill a Friday night.
Bobobo asks super nicely to be allowed to steal the Master Emerald. He even makes a super promise (not legally binding).
Bobobo doesn't like how Amy is brandishing her hammer, so he's not going to advocate for Amy's hair any longer.
Bobobo notices that unlike the legendary Tissue Box Shoes, Amy's boots are not overly suited for running.
Bobobo offers up his legendary Tissue Box Shoes to Amy on the premise that somehow they're going to make her faster.
Aoba's question has made Bobobo suspicious she might be a hair hunter. She's a bit on the short side, but eh.
Bobobo gives a rousing rendition of "Dry Bones" about hair. Hopefully your hair isn't bone dry.
Bobobo continues his rousing rendition of "Dry Bones" about hair. He stops before he gets too far down the human body.
Bobobo misunderstands the question and brings in Don Patch as a result.
Bobobo misunderstands the question and here's Don Patch to further misconstrue things.
Bobobo doesn't seem to understand what he's being asked, but answers has honestly as he can.
Bobobo reveals his hair is entirely home grown.
Bobobo asks about the incident that caused Arash's death.
Bobobo wants to make fun of Colress's Pokemon affiliates, but first he need to know who they are.
Bobobo is not convinced he's not going to end up in a Boot Hill grave.
Bobobo might be slightly afraid of cowboys.
Bobobo explains the very real dangers of being out in the sun too long.
Critical Darling has greeted Don Patch who is using the attention to brag about himself.
Polly asks about Beauty, so Bobobo brings in a character that polls much better than her.
Polly asks about Dengaku-man. D
Polly talks about Gasser, so Bobobo brings in a real stinker.
Polly talks about some useless sack of shit and I'm so angry I cannot remember what I was writing here.
Bobobo rips of DBZ for a way to defeat a incorporeal entity.
Bobobo wears his sunglasses at night, so he can, so he can...
Bobobo regrets his initial move very much. You can see it in his eyes.

Service man wears only a bedsheet over his head and nothing else. His "service" is that he lifts the bottom up to reveal his hairy legs and his unmentionables. He does this quite frequently, sometimes without prompting.
Bobobo takes Fate's advice and figures a move where he won't take off much.
Bobobo takes off all his clothes, but in little tiny pieces. Fate is not pleased.
A sort of beautiful friendship is blooming between Twisted Fate and Bobobo.
Bobobo got his Super Jacket by training at a supermarket in the training mecca called "Eternal."
Bobobo's Super Jacket is powered by his love for his comrades and to a larger extent every supermarket in Japan.
Bobobo thinks Twisted Fate is a wizard, which isn't entirely wrong but seems a bit reductive.
Bobobo urges the player to match him and Fina up more often so he can sell her on the handcuffs.
Don Patch needs a punch in the face every once and a while. Keeps his wildly inflated ego from completely bursting.
Bobobo has a plan and it involves handcuffs.
Fina recognizes Bobobo and Bobobo recognizes Fina!
Bobobo's just here to peep some Fluttershy tits.
Bobobo sees his first shaved crotch.
Bobobo sees a second shaved crotch.
Bobobo sees yet a third shaved crotch.
Bobobo sees that everyone's crotch is shaved.
Bobobo figures Ignatz has seen plenty of nude models already.
Bobobo wonders if naked art imitates naked life or if naked life imitates naked art.
Bobobo hadn't considered the idea of hot aliens before.
Jura seems weirded out by body hair, so Bobobo tries to make her feel more comfortable.
Bobobo shows Jura his extremely hairy chest to calm her down.
Bobobo completes his presentation on his body hair.
Bobobo thinks Kazuma died in a car wreck. Also, a backhanded compliment.
Bobobo no entiende japon√©s y no puede leer el signo de Komi.
The universe compels Bobobo to disobey warnings he cannot read.
Bobobo demonstrates the viability of his nosehair technique.
Bobobo demonstrates the viability of his nosehair technique.
Bobobo demonstrates the viability of his nosehair technique.
Bobobo inquires after Lucina's reason for hiding her identity.
Bobobo reveals he thought Lucina was cute even when she was Marth.
Bobobo reveals his plan to Lucina.
Bobobo reveals his plan, and his nosehairs, to Lucina.
Bobobo reveals his plan, and his underwear, to Lucina.
What? You can't say "Virgin Palace" and expect me not to snicker!
It's gonna be May.
It continues to be becoming May.
Babadada!
Bobobo, in his infinite wisdom, wonders if Meia has possibly run into his brother Bababa-ba Baba-ba somehwere in space.
Space is pretty big and Bobobo sent Bababa into orbit over 20 years ago, so who knows where he ended up.
Bobobo reveals that Hair Kingdom men never go bald and then offres himself up as some sort of space-sperm-donor.
Bobobo reveals that Hair Kingdom men never go bald and then offres himself up as some sort of space-sperm-donor.
Bobobo reveals that Hair Kingdom men never go bald and then offres himself up as some sort of space-sperm-donor.
Bobobo's look baffles Mercy, but he's got a solution.
Bobobo brings up his old rival and childhood friend, Captain Battleship.
Bobobo offers lessons in Fist of the Nosehair. Get ready to get fitted for a donut hat.
Bobobo is at the Inventory playing strip poker. He's got free time to spare! (Plus his manga has been out of syndication for like, a decade.)
Bobobo can offer no meaningful critique of Mercy's hair.
Bobobo has a critique of the manner of dress he's been hallucinated into.
Bobobo pretends to be a ghost who offers hair care advice.
The Ham-Ham crew seems to have at one point partied in Bobobo's fro. They are not welcome back.
Bobobo wishes he had a hot doctor.
Bobobo wants Mercy to give him a checkup...
Because he stabbed himself in the thigh with a bloody pen (not his blood) and he's worried about a possible infection.
Bobobo takes offense to having his hair called "rotund."
Besides, it's just big boned.
Bobobo now thinks Miko is a crab person.
Bobobo names the price for marrying off Don Patch. Now how a dowry works, but alliteration and all that.
Bobobo wants to trade Don Patch for Tojiko, a fairly raw deal for Miko.
Bobobo doesn't know what a Futo is, all he knows is he could go for a burrito.
Bobobo didn't realize you could have someone undress you when you strip.
Bobobo defeated Rice to obtain his necklace, which marks him as King of the Wiggin' Specialists.
Bobobo could easily out-wig Miko or anyone else to get his necklace back.
Bobobo espies a ghost
Bobobo espies a ghost, again.
Bobobo envisions a sitcom style life with a ghost.
Bobobo develops abandoment issues.
Bobobo celebrates an imminant arrival.
Bobobo switches codes.
Bobobo hath doth changeth is codeth.
Bobobo misses the point of Nami's complaints.
Bobobo relents and decides his life will be easier if he just lets Nami Lather, Tabasco, Repeat.
Nami rightly questions the self-importance of Afros, so Bobobo gets defensive.
Bobobo provides what he hopes will be a useful analogy.
A nickname descends from the heavens.
Bobobo can get Pyrrha into the shampoo industry... buuuuut...
As the sole survivor of the Hair Kingdom, Bobobo carries a massive burden.
Bobobo knows that punk rock died when the first kid said...
"Punk's not dead! Punk's. Not. Dead!"
Bobobo simultaniously acknowledges the rivalry between rock and disco in the 70s and implies Revy wants to bone Rock in one fell swoop.
Smoking kills.
Bobobo is hitting on Rosa using bee trivia.
Bees! Bees! THEY'RE EVERYWHERE!!!!
Bobobo is hitting on Rosa using bee trivia.
Bobobo is hitting on Rosa using bee trivia.
Bobobo is hitting on Rosa using bee trivia.
Bobobo states his preference to be called by his full name.
Bobobo reminds Saki what his exact, full name is.
Saki dumps a bucket of water over her head? Is it Bobobo's bucket? Is it full of turtles? Or did they already swim to Mexico?
Bobobo never removes his sunglasses. Why could this be? What is he hiding? Such mystery! Also, he's offended?
Maybe Bobobo is like his brother Bebebe-be Bebe-be who has really cutesy eyes and he doesn't want anyone to know? It's a theory.
Nevermind, he's just under contract. Lame.
Bobobo alludes to the fact that he might know that Saki is a zombie. Or maybe he's just an idiot?
Bobobo recalsl that his own sister, Bububu, was killed in a battle with their older brother.
Bobobo begins the next episode teaser.
Bobobo finishes the next episode teaser.
Hey, at least it wasn't the season finale!
Bobobo (and Don Patch) have made preparations to do their famous Rollercoaster Rap. Hopefully nothing unexpected happens to their bucket of turtles!
Don Patch mentions Fernando.
STREETS
Bobobo implies that Don Patch has some sort of disease, which honestly would you be surprised if he did?
Bobobo implies that Don Patch really is some kind of futuristic robot, and a really advance one at that.
Don Patch is a problem child and Pasta Primavera should be made with fresh spring vegetables.
Bobobo has texted Beauty. If her data plan covers interdimensional communication, maybe she'll text back!
Bobobo hears the voice of someone's hair calling out to him. Is it your hair? Is it mine? Do I smell tofu?
Bobobo has to reveal the secrets the hair has whispered to him.
Bobobo is tired and done listening to people's hair.
Bobobo notes the Trainer's pallid skin and expresses some health concerns.
Bobobo doesn't do haircuts. He does the opposite of haircuts.
Bobobo doesn't do haircuts. He does the opposite of haircuts.
Bobobo doesn't do haircuts. He does the opposite of haircuts. Also, a pun.
Bobobo notes the many similarities between himself and Yang, but he has just one hang-up...
On a scale from 0 to 1, 0 being you would not bang a catgirl and 1 being you would bang a cat girl, where do you stand?
Bobobo is cool with Yuri forgoing her hair's request for a cut.
